intro: Oenothera micrantha var. hirtella, commonly known as the hairy evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and sandy soils. Its hairy stems and leaves are distinctive features that help it retain moisture in arid environments. Oenothera micrantha var. hirtella is also noted for its ecological importance, providing nectar for nocturnal pollinators like moths.
